meanings.sent1: The town was shocked by the iniquities committed by the corrupt officials.
meanings.sent2: She felt burdened by the weight of her family's iniquities.
meanings.sent3: The iniquities of the greedy landlord were exposed when he tried to charge for sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The iniquities of war leave scars that may never fully heal.
meanings.sent5: The iniquities of the past haunted his dreams, reminding him of the darkness within humanity.

meanings.definition: A violation of right or duty; wicked act
meanings.sent1: The iniquities of the thief were evident in the stolen goods found in his possession.
meanings.sent2: The iniquities of the criminal were finally brought to light through thorough investigation.
meanings.sent3: The iniquities of the mischievous cat included stealing socks and hiding them under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The iniquities of gossip can spread like wildfire, causing harm to relationships.
meanings.sent5: The iniquities of the con artist were cleverly disguised, fooling even the most cautious individuals.
